column4: I have a dvd of  pictures that was burned on a MAC and when I insert it I see the volume label but no data.  I installed hfsplus and hfsutils
I think the dvd was burned for / with the MAC filesystem
got another computer around to put the disk into?
no, I just thought to myself (if she's able to get the volume label to appear, then the drive is fine...it's prolly the filesystem on the disk)
I thought that since it can be read on a mac that if I  installed hfsplus I could read it
when you (or whomever) burned the disk...how did they do it?
could it be possible that it is a SLIDESHOW DVD made with iDVD?
suppose anything is possible since I did not burn it.
and not a DATA DVD made with disk utility?
that's code for: "I'm gonna smoke, then google the crap out of this issue!"  LOL
sorry...thought you said you mounted it
thought you were saying hi, but that was to screech...my bad
